images.alt_text: Handwritten letter from Lisa at a community shop in Angus, Scotland, to Friends of Farthing Downs regarding the Welcome Tea Rooms brochure, dated June 3rd 2011
images.caption: Letter from Angus, Scotland (2011) - Community interest in the Welcome Tea Rooms heritage

images.alt_text: Car park at Farthing Downs in Spring 2011, showing gravel parking area with wooden bollards and buildings in background
images.caption: Car park development at Farthing Downs, Spring 2011

images.alt_text: Black and white aerial photograph of Farthing Downs area taken March 3rd 1944, showing fields, hedgerows, and urban development patterns
images.caption: Aerial view of Farthing Downs, March 3rd 1944 - Wartime landscape perspective
images.hero_notes: Dramatic aerial perspective, historically significant wartime documentation

images.alt_text: Estate map from Fairdean Heights Ltd showing property development plan for Farthing Downs area, including St John's Church, recreation grounds, golf course and open spaces
images.caption: Fairdean Heights Ltd. estate development map - Coulsdon and Chaldon Way area planning document

images.alt_text: Three views of a Stone Age flint axe found on Farthing Downs by Brian Hope-Taylor, showing detailed archaeological illustration from Surrey Archaeological Collections XLIX, 1946
images.caption: Stone Age flint axe discovered on Farthing Downs - Evidence of prehistoric settlement (Surrey Archaeological Collections, 1946)
images.hero_notes: Striking archaeological illustration, represents ancient history of the area

images.alt_text: Black and white photograph of children playing on traditional swing boats fairground ride at Farthing Downs, with buildings visible in background
images.caption: Swing boats on Farthing Downs - Traditional recreation and community leisure

images.alt_text: Black and white photograph showing the Welcome Tea Rooms building with a 'NOT WELCOME' sign visible, with a vintage car in the foreground
images.caption: The Welcome Tea Rooms during a period of closure or dispute - Sign reading 'NOT WELCOME' visible on building

images.alt_text: Vintage brochure for The Welcome Tea Rooms at Farthing Downs, Coulsdon, Surrey, showing Old Chaldon Church and the tea rooms building with visitors on the lawn. Proprietor H. Goddard, Phone Merstham 177
images.caption: The Welcome Tea Rooms promotional brochure (front) - Showing the tea rooms and Old Chaldon Church, proprietor H. Goddard
images.hero_notes: Iconic vintage brochure, excellent condition, represents golden era of the tea rooms

images.alt_text: Reverse side of The Welcome Tea Rooms brochure featuring descriptive text about Farthing Downs and interior photograph of the tea rooms dining area with tables and chairs. Includes details about school excursions, parties, and transport options
images.caption: The Welcome Tea Rooms promotional brochure (reverse) - Interior view and details about facilities, location, and services
